intro: Hieracium amnicola, commonly known as the river hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils near rivers and streams, thriving in wetland environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium amnicola plays a role in supporting local insect populations and is often found in riparian zones.
